text: Haughley Road railway station was the original station serving Haughley, Suffolk. It closed in 1849 and was replaced by Haughley railway station which was positioned to serve both branches to the north of the newly constructed Haughley Junction. As in 2017 some or part of the station buildings still survive adjacent to Bacton Road bridge. ==References== Category:Disused railway stations in Suffolk Category:Former Great Eastern Railway stations Category:Railway stations in Great Britain opened in 1846 Category:Railway stations in Great Britain closed in 1849 Category:1846 establishments in England
title: Haughley Road railway station
